questions.title: Question 1 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: In a conditionally unstable atmosphere the environmental lapse rate will be ____ than the moist adiabatic rate and ____ han the dry adiabatic rate.

questions.title: Question 2 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: Under what conditions would the moist adiabatic rate of cooling be almost equal to the dry adiabatic rate?
questions.answer: When there is an extremely small amount of moisture in the air.

questions.title: Question 3 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: Why are moist and dry adiabatic rates of cooling different?
questions.answer: Dry adiabatic rate is roughly 10 degrees C/km while the moist adiabatic rate is usually slower (around 6 degrees C/km) as condensation in the rising air adds latent heat.

questions.title: Question 4 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: The dry adiabatic rate is the rate at which:
questions.answer: B) temperature changes in a rising or descending parcel of unsaturated air

mcq.option: B) temperature changes in a rising or descending parcel of unsaturated air
C) volume changes when a parcel expands or is compressed
D) latent heat energy is released in a rising air parcel

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: If the environmental lapse rate is less than the moist adiabatic rate the atmosphere is:

questions.title: Question 6 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: The temperature an air parcel would have if it were moved to a pressure of 1000 mb at the dry adiabatic rate is called the:

questions.title: Question 7 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: When the environmental lapse rate decreases more rapidly with height than the dry adiabatic rate the atmosphere is:

questions.title: Question 8 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: The rate at which the temperature changes inside a rising (or descending) parcel of saturated air is called the:

questions.title: Question 9 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: The difference between the moist and dry adiabatic rates is due to:
questions.answer: D) the fact that latent heat is released by a rising parcel of saturated air

mcq.option: A) the fact that saturated air is always unstable
B) the fact that an unsaturated air parcel expands more rapidly than a saturated air parcel
C) the fact that moist air weighs less than dry air
D) the fact that latent heat is released by a rising parcel of saturated air

questions.title: Question 10 for Class CLIMATE102_191030
questions.main: Explain the difference between environmental lapse rate and dry adiabatic rate.
questions.answer: The environmental lapse rate is the actual decrease of temperature with altitude.  This is often meaured by instrumented balloon.  The dry adiabatic lapse rate is the rate at which air temperature would drop with altitude due to expansion.
